Title: Tile: Captive Nubian Chieftain
Description: This man has the large earring and tightly curled hairstyle typical of Egyptian depictions of Nubians. When complete, the tile showed the chieftain as a bound prisoner. Such prisoner tiles could have decorated the bases of walls of royal buildings, so the enemies of the pharaoh would be quite literally at his feet.
Provenance: Dikran Kelekian, Paris and New York, [date and mode of acquisition unknown];  Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1929, by purchase;  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Egyptian Art
